thread.title: Rocky Mountain football team looks to build momentum
thread.title_full: Rocky Mountain football team looks to build momentum

title: Rocky Mountain football team looks to build momentum
text:
Rocky Mountain football team looks to build momentum Rocky Mountain hosting winless Mountain Range, looking to start a win streak. Post to Facebook Rocky Mountain football team looks to build momentum Rocky Mountain hosting winless Mountain Range, looking to start a win streak. Check out this story on coloradoan.com: http://noconow.co/1RZ68SK Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Kevin Lytle, kevinlytle@coloradoan.com 12:19 p.m. MDT October 22, 2015 Rocky Mountain’s Sean Miller, left, and Autry Baskin celebrate a play in a game earlier this season. The Lobos host Mountain Range at 7 p.m. Friday. (Photo: Austin Humphreys/The Coloradoan) 13 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Rocky Mountain High School football team got back on track last week. 
Now the Lobos hope to start rolling. Rocky Mountain (4-3, 2-3 Front Range League) snapped a two-game losing streak by beating Poudre last week. 
Friday at 7 p.m. Rocky Mountain hosts winless Mountain Range (0-7, 0-5 FRL) in the penultimate game of the regular season. 
Why it matters: Rocky Mountain sits 17th in the first edition of wild card points, used to select the 32-team Class 5A playoff field. 
The Lobos have a chance to host a first-round playoff game, but need to win Friday against Mountain Range and next week at Monarch to keep that hope alive. 
To win, Mountain Range must: Force turnovers. It’s really the only way Mountain Range could pull off the upset. The Mustangs won’t be able to completely stop the rushing monster of Rocky Mountain. 
The Lobos average 229 yards per game and 5.5 per carry. It’s not likely the Mustangs can stop Cade Hairgrove (135 yards per game) and Autry Baskin (62 per game), but forcing multiple turnovers could make the chance for an upset. 
To win, Rocky Mountain must: Start fast. Mountain Range’s closest loss was 12 points and the Mustangs haven’t scored more than 14 points in a game all season. 
Rocky Mountain needs to put the hammer down right away and not give Mountain Range any hope for an upset. If the Lobos can score a couple touchdowns early, they will win. 
Follow sports reporter Kevin Lytle at twitter.com/Kevin_Lytle and at facebook.com/KevinSLytle. 
Local Week 8 weekend schedule 
Friday: Mountain Range at Rocky Mountain, 7 p.m. Twitter updates: @Kevin_Lytle . Watch: Coloradoan.com 
Friday: Fossil Ridge at Fairview, 7 p.m. at Recht Field. Twitter updates: @ColoradoanSpts 
Saturday: Resurrection Christian at Cornerstone Christian, 7 p.m. Twitter updates: @ColoradoanSpts 13 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://noconow.co/1RZ68SK TOP VIDEOS
